title: Drawing, "Design for two andirons", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red, green, black watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed:
Above, at lower center, pen and brown ink: 59765
Below, at lower center, pen and brown ink: 59766; graphite: 74f
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Above: front panel shows head of Medusa, flanked by sphinx heads atop pilasters, a flower head on center block and festooned legs below. 
Below: elongated panel, two female spirits kneel beside a flaming tripod. Caducei decorate pilasters. On top of left pilaster, a sauceboat. At right, a bowl on stand.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for two andirons", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red, green, black watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-162.
